.definition: go somewhere to collect someone, typically in one's car.
.example: She dropped by to pick up her friend.

.definition: used to describe that something is partly true but it’s not the entire explanation.
.example: Your answer is sort of correct but there’s a bit more to it that that.

.definition: used to emphasize the great degree of something
.example: She had such a strange sense of humor.

.definition: to happen, especially after previously being arranged or planned
.example: No one was sure exactly why it took place there.

.definition: shows that a particular thing always happened or was true in the past
.example: We don’t go to the movies now as often as we used to.

.definition: to take action to do something, especially to solve a problem
.example: The police had several issues to deal with.

.definition: because of
.example: Many people believe it is due to global warming.

.definition: used to show that you must do something
.example: I exercise because I have to.

.definition: with the purpose or intention of doing or achieving something
.example: We shared a room in order to reduce costs

.definition: in addition to, and
.example: We have a responsibility to our community as well as to our families.

.definition: in other words
.example: It’s fine, but, I mean, is it worth the price?

.definition: to be an introduction to or the cause of something
.example: Excessive smoking can lead to heart disease.

.definition: to be likely to do something or to happen in a particular way
.example: I tend to think it’s actually a political matter.

.definition: used an idea, a fact, a situation, etc. as the point from which something can be developed
.example: Based on the reports, it seems it was an accident.

.definition: used to show what somebody intends to do in the future
.example: "I'll be going to Wembley this Saturday.

.definition: used to show what aspect of a subject you are talking about or how you are thinking about it
.example: If history is any kind of indicator, by 2013 we'll return to money defined in terms of something real.

.definition: used to describe that something exists or is in a certain place
.example: There is a temple on the top of the hill

.definition: with regard to, according to
.example: There was some confusion as to its whereabouts.

.definition: in a way that suggests something
.example: They walked together as if no time had passed.

.definition: to not be able to do what you are trying to achieve or are expected to do
.example: The secretary failed to call the customer and the company lost the account

.definition: to indicate that you are giving more detailed information about what you have just said.
.example: Painters who are in fact anything but unsophisticated

.definition: to search for someone or something
.example: We are looking for a partner in a new business venture.

.definition: used to say that something which was possible or true before, is not now
.example: Fortunately, it is no longer a concern now.

.definition: anyway; the good thing is that
.example: We've run out of coffee, but at least we still have tea.

.definition: to a small degree or somewhat
.example: "I am a little hungry, so let us buy some snacks."

.definition: definitely or as might be expected
.example: "Of course, I will be at the party!"

.definition: to arrange, organize or prepare
.example: "I need to set up a sound system for tonight's party."

.definition: used to say that two related statements are true
.example: Not only is she pretty, but she's also very smart.

.definition: small in number
.example: "I bought a few things at the convenience store."

.definition: the thing or things that you are about to mention
.example: The following items were found – a ring, a wallet, and a watch.

.definition: one only
.example: A single customer was left in the shop.

.definition: used for saying that one thing is preferred to another or happens instead of another
.example: She wants us to meet her here rather than go to her apartment.

.definition: done or experienced in the past, but no longer done or experienced
.example: We don’t go to the movies now as often as we used to.

.definition: not any person
.example: I called twice, but no one answered.

.definition: (not used as the subject of a sentence) the other person, or any or all the other people in a group
.example: The couple kept looking at each other and smiling.

.definition: a large number; a bunch
.example: "She smiles a lot when she's happy."

.definition: to perform; to do
.example: The soldiers are going to carry out their mission tonight.

.definition: for example
.example: "I listen to music such as rock and classical."

.definition: used to introduce a clause of purpose
.example: Park it so that the wheels are curbed.

.definition: a small amount of something
.example: There was a bit of drama today at the office.

.definition: to indicate that something is probably the case or will probably happen in a particular situation
.example: That disease is known to be likely to cause death.

.definition: to continue doing something or being in a situation
.example: I'm all right here. Go on with your work.

.definition: used to express an action which will happen (in the future)
.example: Obama is to address the media this afternoon.

.definition: an unspecified number of; several or many
.example: A number of concerns were raised.

.definition: (used for emphasis) in any way; to any extent.
.example: I'm afraid I have nothing at all to say.

.definition: used when talking about a time in the past to say what happened later
.example: The message was to be transmitted worldwide.

.definition: people who
.example: He would defend those who had no voice.

.definition: You use have got to when you are saying that something is necessary or must happen in the way stated.
.example: I'm not happy with the situation, but I have got to accept it.

.definition: in addition; too
.example: They advertised the new movie on television, and in newspapers as well.

.definition: indicating a maximum amount
.example: The process is expected to take up to two years.

.definition: used in present tense situations usually in informal writing and in ordinary speech
.example: I have got 3 dogs and 2 cats.
